comment.text:
IF you've never eaten here, it should be on your list. This was my second time eating at South City Kitchen and first at this location. I previously had brunch at the other location near Sandy Springs, and it's still one of my higher ranked brunch spots.

We did valet parking and only had to tip. You'll probably want to wear something semi-dressy, as this tips the scales as being closer to fine dining. Ambiance and mood is very relaxed.

Our table did a few appetizers: fried green tomatoes, crab cakes and Gouda fritters (along with the house muffins and biscuits). All of it was amazing! The Gouda fritters were my favorite. I had a blood orange beer on tap that tasted more like a Weiss beer and it was good. Their old fashioned was also very good!

My entree, the Carolina trout, was just ok. Not enough fish to satisfy and just wasn't cooked to my liking. However, I had a bite of someone's strip steak and it was absolutely fantastic! Our waitress was stellar!

Overall, a great experience! I would highly recommend eating here for a company dinner or date night.

Was there for brunch recently.  The valet was closed so we parked in the garage ($14, no validation).  I had coffee.  My wife had an Aperol spritz and a latte.  She said that here drinks were good.  My coffee was fine.

The corn muffins are quite good.  Not too sweet and great texture with a crispy outside.  They put cinammon in the apple butter.  My wife likes that; I don't.

I started with the she-crab soup.  This was delicious.  Rich with excellent crab flavor and a few chunks of lump crab.  You could taste the sherry but it was not overpowering.  That is a really great soup.

Then we waited.  We waited about 25 minutes for our entrees.  My wife had the crab rice and I had the fried chicken with mashed potatoes and collards.  Her crab rice was meh.  There was a sour flavor that might have been due to the aoli.   The fried chicken is technically perfect.  You get a airline breast.  The crust was crispy and the meat juicy.  The chicken is underseasoned and bland though.  Unfortunately, the potatoes were also gummy and underseasoned.  A fail.  The collards are good...not outstanding but fine.

We skipped dessert.  Yelp does not allow half-points and South City Kitchen Buckhead is more like a 3 1/2 for me.  The soup was excellent.  Our server did a great job but the kitchen took much to long to serve the mains.  The main dishes were meh.  Sorry about the photos.  I started both dishes before I remembered to take a pic.

Out of all the places we ate at on our Georgia trip, I would say South City Kitchen Buckhead was our favorite, however, it is more on the upscale side for southern food. There was a party going on when we came, so just in case you should make a reservation to ensure you don't have to wait. We were lucky when we arrived on a Friday night because they had a free table for 3. 
After we ordered, they started us off with complementary bun and corn bread. I'm not sure what kind of bread it was, but the bun was super soft and airy.
Pei Mussels ($16) - included andouille sausage, white wine, chili flakes, with grilled baguette. The sauce makes a great dip for bread.
She-Crab Soup in a bowl ($10) - included cream sherry, pieces of real crab meat, with olive oil drizzle. 
Springer Farm Fried Chicken ($25) - included a fried white meat chicken breast, collard greens, mashed red bliss, honey-thyme potatoes. I usually don't like white meat because it's on the dry side, but this chicken was juicy and well-seasoned. The collard greens were good, and the mashed potato was creamy.
Side of Fried Okra ($7) - My friends enjoyed this more than me because I am not a fan of the slimy interior of okra.
Service was smooth, so we did not have to wait long for food. This was a great last dinner here!

Ohh I soo wanted to love this place but didn't. Ambiance 5 stars but food lacked seasoning so 3.75 stars.  Drinks were sooo yum 5 stars. Ugh.  So that's why I gave 4 stars. I had chicken dish. Hefty portions (ask for everything to be separated if you don't want soggy chicken). She-Crab soup
Was very heavy and cheesy. Price was decent considering style of restaurant.

photos.caption: Chicken, Collard Greens, and red mashed potatoes

comment.text:
This spot is a joint that has no weakspots when it comes to food.  The service, elite.  The ambience, a vibe.  The food, elevated tier.  The bar situation, solid. They have a downstairs and an upstairs.  The upstairs area you can get a view of Peachtree road so its a nice ambience there.  

The bar area there is decently big but they have a lot of selection for you (and some nice specials on the menu to boot).  

The waitstaff is always stellar.  They haven't missed.  They will be prompt with you and in the downtime they will stop and talk to you instead of throwing your food on the table and bouncing away.  Makes you feel like a person instead of a table number.

On my last visit I got the king biscuit and it was NOT what I expected (I guess I expected a biscuit sandwich of some sort).  This was not it, but it was a welcomed surprise.  Kind of an opened faced sandwich situation that had MAD flavor!

There is parking but its valet, so just be aware.  Its like 2 dollars, so it isnt that bad, but dont expect a lot of street parking, it is on Peachtree RD so I assume you already know how that is.  That should not deter you though!  If you havent, you need to dabble in this!

This place is somewhat upscale but not all the way. You can be dressed up or somewhat casual. With reservations made we only waited about 5minutes. 

The waitress was very polite and knowledgeable of the menu. She suggested the grits, so that's what I got. Strongly recommend getting the bread basket. Those bread muffins were delicious. 

I recommend sitting on the patio if the weather permits it. 

There's a parking garage right behind the restaurant l, that's steps away. 

Will definitely return.

Im in Atlanta for a weekend and am staying at the Intercontinental which is a 4 minute walk. I'm glad we came -- everything we ate was tasty, the server attentive, and nice ambiance (white tablecloths, not noisy). When we said we were from out of town, our server recommended three classic southern dishes that are popular - fried green tomato's, shrimp & grits, and the fried chicken. All were great--especially the shrimp & grits. The grits were creamy and the sauce had a slight kick. The cocktail - ugly sweater - mentioned gin & earl gray so I was excited but it was overpowered by whatever citrus was used (lemon?)

We had a meal for two - appetizer, entree, dessert and cocktails - for $140 including tip. Quite reasonable!

How heartbreaking this location was. 
It was no longer the pure southern cooking of the midtown location I knew and loved. 

Service was great, as was the ambiance, but the food was ruined for me.  Some fancy, fusion, take on southern food that is just unnecessary. 

I'm in tears.

Definitely on the upscale side for southern food. Portions were very small but the food was absolutely amazing. The chicken was flavorful, mashed potatoes were creamy and the heirloom carrots were seasoned very well. 

We made reservations and I highly recommend that. Parking was in the garage nearby and I believe they offer valet too. 

Overall, I would come here again.

We had a family lunch set up but really wanted some southern specialties, so we did brunch before lunch here.  The patio sounded unappealing on a 15 degree F cold spell Sunday morning, but it's actually a beautiful covered / enclosed patio with heaters and a fireplace, and I would argue it's nicer than the inside since there's lots of natural light. 

I started with an Up & At Em: a gin based brunch cocktail - super light and refreshing with kumquat. 

They start you with warm cornbread and biscuits, which are amazing. The biscuit was so fluffy, nicely salted, good with their peach jam.

- Fried green tomatoes: layered with with goat cheese and fried, sitting on a red pepper coulis. It was nicely fried with a thin crisp cornmeal crust and not too greasy. Loved the goat cheese tang with it 
- Fried chicken and waffles: one of their specialties. The chicken was nicely brined, flavorful and super moist (white meat). You can add pecans to the waffles for $2, which adds a nice crunch. The waffle was fluffy.

Service was pretty quick and very friendly. It was a great place for elevated southern specialties and brunch. Again, get a seat on the patio if you can!

Parking: valet is free if you're dining there. No validation for the paid parking lot.

Wonderful service and delicious food. A little expensive but the food was really good so I guess it made it worth it. At first we struggled to find the front door to the restaurant but once inside, we were pleased with our visit and would like to return!

We went here for lunch on a Friday evening. We got there a little late due but they still accommodated us. The service was swift. The servers worked efficiently to ensure timely service. Everyone received their food at the same times. 

The she-crab soup contained real crab meat. The fried green tomatoes were amazing especially with the sauce. It is tomato saucy. The pimento cheese was good with plenty of options included. I didn't have the pickles but people raved on them. 

My entree was the Springer Farm fried chicken. It was fresh and seasoned well. The greens were good and the mashed potatoes were really creamy. 

Others had the Grilled Salmon. They did not care for it. They stated the salmon was okay but it was just that. 

The bathroom was also nice.

Visited South City Kitchen on a Friday night - I did have a reservation so I was seated very quickly. The ambiance was nice, very quiet and intimate as the restaurant has small rooms versus one large dining area so overall it had a great ambiance. My server introduced herself and gave us a great description of the restaurant and the signature menu items. She also gave great insight to drink pairings. Our service the entire night was amazing. 

For starters I ordered the Farmstead Gouda Fritters and the She-Crab soup. The Fritters were absolutely delicious - so creamy on the inside but nice and crispy and the honey  glaze was perfectly balanced. I would definitely order this again and again. The soup was so delicate, light and creamy. I really enjoyed the soup. 

For my entree I ordered the Chatel Farms Strip Steak (medium), Shrimp and Marsh Hen Mill Grits and the Fried Okra. The steak was nicely cooked however a bit bland on flavor, the fingerling potatoes and grilled baby gem were delicious. The Shrimp & Grits was very tasty and had perfect ratios of the gravy to grits. The okra was perfect crispy and the sauce that comes with it was light and savory. I would definitely visit again to try the brunch menu. 

Would recommend for a quiet, intimate date night.

We came to South City Kitchen for Mother's Day as a last minute pick. It was amazing to say the least. The only reason why I'm giving it a four is because of the mishap of our food. However the manager Sheldon took very good care of us. He jumped on it when he realized we had been waiting for our food for an extended period of time. To compensate us he took half of the bill off. It was super packed because of the holiday weekend so we sat at the bar. That was all us though because we didn't have a reservation. The ambiance was beautiful as well as the atmosphere. Everyone was super friendly and welcoming. 
We will be back again

While I think it can be a bit pricey, the experience at SCK in Buckhead is always nice. I have been multiple times, but recently had their brunch on Sunday. Let's just say I got the super food coma after lol.

Generally the wait staff is very kind and the food is good whether it's breakfast or dinner. SCK is a good staple restaurant that never disappoints.
Fantastic! The food, the service, the ambiance, the art, so much attention to detail. My husband and I loved every aspect of this visit.  Cannot wait to return.

Always a great spot for a filling dinner and classy environment. I booked a reservation and my guest and I were sat immediately. The starter bread is soo good. I had the lemonade cocktail and it was sweet and delicious. For dinner I got the fried chicken and she ordered the beef cheek, we both ate until we were stuffed. For dessert she enjoyed the cheesecake. I've been to this midtown location but this was my first time in Buckhead and both are top notch.

It was hard to choose so I thought I would start with an appetizer.  Unfortunately I filled up on that and didn't order a meal.  Next time I do go back I will definitely get the fried chicken.  

Staff was very friendly and engaging! I appreciate my first time eating there was a pleasant experience!

photos.caption: PIMENTO CHEESE with crackers and veggies

comment.text:
Nice elevated southern menu. Definitely a hot spot so make reservations if you are limited on time. They have a cool full bar with a fun atmosphere. The bartenders and bar backs are hustling as they are really busy, and still able to pay great attention to their bar full of clientele. I think I waited about 15 min for a seat at the bar. Not too bad. And I was offered to order a drink by 2 separate bartenders. So they are on point! Open kitchen as well. You do t really see it from the bar but as I was walking out I saw 5 fried chicken dishes ready to serve as well as about 5 pork chops. Those pork chops sure looked good!

I ordered the fried green tomatoes and their fried chicken. And the corn bread & biscuit basket was delish!

The fried green tomatoes were amazing! Nice golden fry on them and they were also "stuffed" with goat cheese. They were wading in a shallow bath of a delicious red pepper coulis, drizzled with olive oil. Very good!!! I could have used more olive oil but I ate it up too fast before I had a chance to ask for oil. 

The fried chicken was accompanied by buttery red bliss mashed potatoes (YUM!!!), and collard greens. The chicken had a great fry on it, but I would have liked it if it was a little more juicy. That being said, I would defiantly order it again. The potatoes were amazing and used more butter than Julia Childs. Good on them! They were delicious while still not too rich. The collard greens were good as well. I would have liked a little bit of fat in them (bacon/pork belly, pancetta, guanciale, etc.). Reflecting back it did counter the butter which might be the reason they were not too rich. Overall, again, I would order the dish again. 

I didn't order dessert but the banana pudding seemed to be the house special. Maybe I'll try it next time. 

Parking is available in the attached (sort of) parking garage. Unfortunately they do not validate, but not a deal breaker. Parking was $14 for the duration of my meal.

photos.caption: Corn bread and biscuit basket. M-M-GOOD!
Food in the pass looking delish!

comment.text:
I came here as part of BBQ and bourbon pairing event with ASW. The event started with a cocktail walkthrough from one of their bartenders. It was delicious. A riff on an old fashioned called "It had to be you" (A Frank Sinatra reference). Perfectly balanced and delicious served with a big cube of crystal clear ice.

After a quick rundown of the ASW bourbons we tucked into a buffet of BBQ. They had all the meats. Tritip, pulled pork, chicken, sausage, even head cheese. Of course the pickles and traditional sides made an appearance as well. All the food was great, the drinks especially so. I always look for South City when I hit up food festivals, they always put out good food.

What can I say...if no one else will do it...I will ‍

Had a nice self care date a couple months ago!! Started off getting my tresses trimmed and tamed at @themodclass , then went to @southcitykitchen.atl Buckhead for a bite to eat! 


Parking decks are available -- less than a block walk uphill. 



Even though I had a reservation, it wasn't too busy that I couldn't have been seated with no wait. 

:
I had a reservation when they opened at 5pm -- I arrived 10 mins early and was politely informed I could be seated at time of open/reservation.

Seating available inside foyer. 

Even though the wait time was longer than expected being the only person in the restaurant, my waitress quickly made up for the delay with amazing recommendations and customer service.

 / :
Ask for Amari - when I tell you she knows her stuff!!! She made everything on the menu sound like the #1 draft pick and let me tell you, if I had more room
In my stomach I would have definitely ordered more.

This is a no judgement zone tho - I ate most of everything I ordered cause it was just that good!!!

  
- Smoked Pork Belly 
- Farmstead Gouda Fritters
- Shrimp & Marsh Hen Hill Grits
- Vanilla Bean Cheesecake 

  

- A Night With Rosalita 
- Country Thyme Lemonade 
- Turn the Beat Around

#ATLdinner #atlhairstylist #southcitykitchenbuckhead #southcitykitchen #atldate

Check out my reel here: https://www.instagram.com/reel/Cv0f4BIAJEW/?igshid=MzRlODBiNWFlZA==
Good food, great muffins and biscuits, and great New York Sour! Had a nice time with friends, absolutely loved the fried chicken, muffins, biscuits, and New York Sour!

From the moment we walked in, our waiter Kevin was spectacular. Brimming with welcoming energy and enthusiasm, he helped make this dining experience feel like we were sitting in our own kitchen. 

South City is known for its fried green tomatoes, so we began our meal with the perfectly battered, goat-cheese filled appetizer. A little history lesson for you: surprisingly, fried green tomatoes were first introduced to the States by Jewish immigrants in the 19th century, only having been made popular by the movie with the namesake in 1991. For my main course, I ate the smoked pork belly covered in a ground mustard, tender and juicy with every bite. I loved it! This was accompanied by the grape salad, which wasn't my favorite. There was a sweetness to the smoked pork belly, so next time I plan on opting for a more savory side like the Caesar salad. Grapes are good for wine, and that's the my favorite form a grape! 

South City Kitchen is an Atlanta staple. It stays true to Atlanta's southern roots, just not a mom-and-pop and a little more wearing your Sunday best. South City Kitchen serves a mean brunch as well, so tell your gal pals.

3.5 stars

South City Kitchen was a beautiful restaurant with dark, sleek décor and a sprawling patio.  Our friendly server stopped by to take our beverage order and to drop off a bread basket, which was really the highlight of the meal, in my opinion.  Its contents included buttery, soft biscuits and heavenly corn muffins in which you could see the fresh kernels.  My entrée of the Chef's Chicken Chopped Salad was packed with local greens, pecan-smoked bacon, peppadews, tomatoes, cucumbers, feta, and sugar snap peas; I have to say that I love a salad with a bunch of ingredients.  However, the included grilled chicken was rather bland and a bit chewy.  It reminded me of pre-sliced chicken strips you would buy at the supermarket.  The balsamic vinaigrette and green goddess dressing helped add some flavor, but I still found the salad just mediocre; perhaps I did not order the right thing to evaluate the SCK food?

Overall, I found South City Kitchen to be fine, but did not live up to the rave reviews I had seen/heard.

This place doesn't need my adoration let alone another glowing review. I'm just here to pile on and express my love for South City Kitchen. First off, the service is exceptional. The staff is friendly, attentive, and engaged with their customers. They take time with you and seem very invested in making your meal a great experience. Second, this place has a wonderful ambiance and good energy that makes your meal feel more special. And last but not least, the food is very good. I can't say enough about the friend chicken or fried  green tomatoes,  it the baked goods, crab cakes, salads, and sandwiches  have all been perfectly executed and nicely presented. Their cocktails also reflect a great attention to detail and craft. 

I'm a big fan of great execution and I'm blown away by South City's consistency. If there was one knock I'd offer it's a bit more diversity on the menu along with more frequently specials and seasonal rotation. Beyond that, if you're looking for a great contemporary southern dining experience or a place for a specI'll meal, South City Kitchen is a fine choice.
Decent food and ambiance. Will have to come back to try more options. Service was welcoming.

We made a reservation and came for brunch on a Saturday morning with a group of 5 people. Our waitress was great and definitely listened to our needs when we asked about getting a bottle of champagne and a cup of orange juice so we could make our own mimosa's instead of having the pre-poured pitcher that usually has too much juice and not enough champagne. The king biscuit was fine. I think the biscuit was cooked too hard and they were depending on the gravy to soften it up quite a bit. I likely wouldn't order it again.

We went during 4th of July and they were serving their brunch menu (brunch is usually only on weekends) so that was nice. Unexpected big portions, especially since they also gave us free basket of biscuit and cornbread. Pretty good service and cute vibes. 

They are known for the chicken so I got the King's Biscuit with chicken instead of ham. Baller move

photos.caption: chicken and SPRINGER MOUNTAIN FARMS FRIED CHICKEN & BUTTERMILK WAFFLE

comment.text: Great food and great service. Good selections of food choices. I will return! Nice ambience also.

It was good.   I liked the cornbread and grits.  The pork chop was ok but not something I would order again.  My son enjoyed the fried tomatoes and the pimento cheese was excellent.  My son thought the steak was mediocre.  The service was a bit spotty. Started out strong but extended periods of no one around.  I would go there again but probably not my first choice.  Solid B to B+.

I had an amazing breakfast experience here this morning! I made reservations due to other reviews mentioning how full they can get and it was the best decision. My server, Ieesha, was very friendly and attentive. The manager also helped out with clearing plates which I think was also nice and welcoming. The decor is super cute and there's 'patio' seating that offers great views and lots of natural lighting. I started with the fried green tomatoes and they were phenomenal. Anything that comes with goat cheese is a win for me! My entree was the chicken and waffles. The waffle was malted so it was very light and soaked up the syrup. The chicken was well seasoned and juicy. Don't let me forget my Bellini. There's valet parking for only $2!! Can't beat that! I love it here and will definitely be returning!

If you are looking for upscale southern cooking then you've come to the right chain. Not being a southern native I wanted to check out some of the highly rated dishes including fried green tomatoes. I thought they were executed well and nicely seasoned. I also really enjoyed their bread basket, especially their corn bread because they had corn kernels. I got one of the seasonal dishes the Carolina gold (mushroom and corn) risotto, which had a great texture. The risotto was very rich and probably had more cream and butter than I care to know. I couldn't finish it because I'm not used to eating such rich food. My partner had the fried chicken which was done well but not super exciting. 

There did seem to be a distinction in service and seating of people who come without reservations vs those who were having a work lunch. Things were brought out pretty slowly and we weren't checked on often despite it being a Monday at lunchtime and for the price and location I felt a little disappointed.

photos.caption: Carolina Gold Risotto and Springer Mountain Farms Fried Chicken

comment.text: Beautiful establishment, great food, however the service definitely could have been better. We visited this restaurant for my grandmother's 96th birthday and our service definitely left us feeling unwelcome. My sweet grandmother was still able to enjoy herself, but we just wished it could have been a better experience. As a former server myself, I always tried to keep in mind that despite my personal life, I am here to serve guests and give them an unforgettable experience. You never know how you can make or break someone's day.

This place was amazing! Tucked away off of Peachtree Road in Buckhead. The location is great and so convenient. Me and my family came here for the first time the weekend of the Beyoncé concert. They had valet parking or you could south park in the parking deck across the walkway. I'm so happy that I was able to make a reservation online because it was packed. We did still have to wait because they have a policy that your full party has to be present in order to seat you, understandable. Once everyone arrived, we were seated in their outside cabana area. We decided to start off with the mimosa carafe, which was very strong and delicious! The complementary corn bread and biscuits was to die for! The orange marmalade that comes with it is unforgettable. Our party ordered a variety of different dishes from salmon to chicken and waffles to the smothered biscuit. Everything was great! I will definitely be returning. The ambience and vibe on the outside of the restaurant was very relaxing with the overhead fans, while you watched the views from the street. This restaurant is definitely on my list now for brunch.

photos.caption: SPRINGER MOUNTAIN FARMS FRIED CHICKEN & BUTTERMILK WAFFLE

comment.text:
This place was packed. I've never had such a difficult time getting a solo seat at a bar without TVs! Hovered a bit and swooped in as someone left. 

Food was nothing fantastic but not horrible. 

I would probably find another place to go next time I'm in town.

The chicken is legit. 
The waffles are good 
Biscuits and corn muffins are nice appetizers 
6 of us 
All entrees.  225 coconuts

We've been to this location a few times and each time the food was great and the service was on point. I usually get the fried chicken and the house hot sauce. It's my favorite meal. It's usually busy whenever we've gone, and have only sat at the bar. The location is nice and I believe there is an outdoor dining area. You will need to valet if you drive.

The ambiance is southern and natural with nice music. The service from Iesha is outstanding. She is friendly and highly suggestive. The meal I selected was the fried chicken liver 1st, accompanied by these outstandingly soft delicious biscuits and finally entree was their signature chicken & pecan waffles.

photos.caption: Springer Mountain Farms Fried Chicken & Malted Buttermilk Waffle

comment.text: I came here with my coworkers after work. It's near Lenox in the heart of Buckhead so parking costs. There are decks around. I'm not sure if they validate since I walked there from the office. The restaurant itself is nicely decorated and the service was impeccable. Our server was knowledgeable and friendly. We ordered a few apps. The lump crab cake, pork belly, and pimento cheese. Everything was delicious. As an entree I had the pork chop and it did not disappoint. It was very flavorful and a thick cut piece of meat served on veggies. The drinks were also tasty and no complaints were heard from the table. Will definitely return.

Nice little place with outside seating area and inside area with a bar. I went with a couple of friends for dinner, and we went with several options to share.
First, we started with the charcuterie board. I would say it was lacking for the price. three pieces of each dry ham three pieces of a Genoa. Pickled tomatoes and okra and no cheese on the board. we told the waiter no cheese, and he went and got us three pieces of cheese. really sad. We followed up and split the fried chicken. did not taste like buttermilk fried, the shrimp and grits were good but not the best. and the fried green tomatoes were only three pieces and were good. I would say the service was just ok. no real attention to detail, and one thing that really bugged me about the wait staff is that they kept coming by and trying to take our plates away while we were still eating. It was not the best experience but great dinner friends!

Was in Atlanta for business and it was suggested that this would be a good place for a dinner but unfortunately couldn't get a reservation so I went in for lunch with a colleague.

Nice place and very good service.

We ordered fried green tomatoes and Gouda fritters to share and I had the Nashville fried chicken sandwich with the house made chips.

The appetizers were awesome and could have keep eating them as my meal. Wonderful flavor. The Nashville fried chicken was also excellent - the bun was a little much so mostly ate the fried chicken without the roll. I would order it again for sure. The house made chips were ok not great but ok - if I were to visit again I would order the fries.

Was excited for southern food here, and regret not trying the fried green tomatoes. Rounding my average 3.5 rating up to a 4 here. My partner and I ordered the Springer Mountain Farms Fried Chicken & Buttermilk Waffle, and the Pulled Pork BBQ Sandwich, plus Banana Pudding Trifle for dessert -
 
TASTE: 3/5 - we enjoyed the bowl of biscuits and corn muffins, w morsels of corn in them, to start, plus butter and a sweet cinnamon(?) spread. My fried chicken and waffle were good, but especially when doused w the Vermont maple syrup. The pulled pork BBQ sandwich was alright, and its side of BBQ sauce and well-seasoned chips were better. We loved the strong banana and dulce de leche flavors in the pudding. Overall, our meal was okay but we thought it'd dazzle us more 
TEXTURE: 3/5 - my waffle was perfectly made and the fried chicken also had a great crisp, however we were disappointed by how dry the pulled pork was and the choice of a ciabatta bun (I love the softness of brioche). Wish we got more of the candied corn puffs layered throughout the pudding, not just the vanilla wafers 
PRICE: 4/5 - expected prices for brunch 
SERVING SIZE: 4/5 - filled us up for lunch 
SERVICE: 3/5 - didn't mind being seated at the bar since we walked in at noon on a Saturday. However, the plates still had some food residue on them and our waiter gave us our bill without asking if we'd like dessert after our entrees
ATMOSPHERE: 4/5 - a nice, large space w modern decor
PARKING: 4/5 - when you pass South City Kitchen on Peachtree Rd, turn right and the valet station will be on your right, past the SCK doors. Valet parking was $2, without tip!

photos.caption: Springer Mountain Farms Fried Chicken & Buttermilk Waffle

comment.text: This spot is a must if you're in town for business. Great vibes with amazing service. The flavors were spot on and the quality of ingredients can be felt with each bite. The livers were a hefty portion that were rich and cooked well such that they tasted livery but not overwhelmingly so. The okra wasn't slimy and the grits were a hug for the tummy.

If you're looking for a posh indoor/outdoor brunch spot in Buckhead this Spring, then South City Kitchen is for you. The complimentary biscuits and cornbread with strawberry jam were an amazing start. The Springer Mountain Farms Fried Chicken with mashed potatoes and collard greens hit the spot for me. The chicken was perfectly crispy on the outside and deliciously juicy on the inside. The smashed red potatoes and slightly sweet and smoky greens complemented the dish. Service was good but slightly slow. We had a resevation and only waited about 5 minutes to be seated on the covered mezzanine level. Complimentary valet parking is available.

Pretty restaurant inside. I like being able to see into the kitchen, and it smelled good for sure. There's a valet outside that was quick and convenient.

Servers and staff were lovely but I only rate it so low because of the lack of vegan options, the chef was able to accommodate and make something plant based (potatoes and beans) -- but unfortunately it was pretty bland. 

The bbq sauce was good and definitely helped the potatoes, and the waitress recommended a grenadine lemonade which I loved and was served in a large portion.

It's definitely an affordable option with the convenience of accepting reservations. We were in and out pretty quickly, but I likely wouldn't return.

Great place with a southern flare.  The atmosphere is great and the food was excellent.  I had the She crab soup which was delicious and then had the fried chicken which was equally as good.  The corn bread was also great.  You will enjoy this place.

I haven't had bad dish yet The risotto, green salad, steak, and banana pudding are my faves. The crab cake wasn't too bad! The interior decor is beautiful and has great views of the city. Now I've had the same server the last two times and she was moving a bit slow. The others I observed had some hustle. Oh yea parking in Buckhead is valet or use the deck.

Good food! Good service and nice ambiance!! The food was fresh and tasted delicious. Their Gouda fritters are too good. The trout fish (nip) was excellent. Desert was great. Definitely recommend this place!!

We pickled this venue for a friend's birthday. I loved the ambiance, we were seating on the second floor and had the whole small private room to ourselves. Our servers were amazing, very prompt and personal, we loved them! But the food was not what I would expected, appetizers were ok, I'm the seafood person, and crab soup was bitter, trout was okay too, pork was pink? Hmm... I'm not sure if this is how it was supposed to served or it was just bad during our visit. Not quite impressed with the food. Will reconsider it if we would be back. But overall everyone had great time thanks to the servers and their fabulous cocktails!

I had a corporate meeting here with about 20 people in their upstairs private room. The service was exceptional. It's a beautiful restaurant as well and we had use of their upstairs patio which was lovely. The cocktails were delicious. I ordered the fried chicken with collards and potatoes. They are known for their fried chicken so I had high expectations. Unfortunately I was a little disappointed. The chicken was cooked properly and was juicy/tender. However the amount of liquid on the plate was too much for me and the flavor was a little bland. Overall it was a great dining experience but I will try a different dish next time.
